Requirement_Description: All crew members shall be qualified and current per regulatory requirements and company standards
All operations shall be conducted per approved Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
All flights shall be dispatched and operated within approved weather minima
All flights shall carry sufficient H2 fuel per regulations (trip + reserves)
All flights shall be within approved weight and CG limits
Verification_Method: Load planning / Crew verification / CAOS validation

Requirement_Description: Takeoff and landing performance shall be calculated for actual conditions
Aircraft shall be dispatched only in compliance with approved MEL
CAOS recommendations shall be monitored and evaluated by crew before implementation
A 50m radius safety zone shall be established during all H2 refueling operations
H2 leak detection system shall be operational for all flight and ground operations with H2 onboard
H2 compartment ventilation shall maintain <10% LEL at all times
Only certified H2 refueling personnel shall conduct refueling operations
Appropriate H2 fire-fighting equipment shall be positioned during all refueling operations
H2 storage temperature shall be monitored continuously and remain within -258°C to -248°C
H2 system pressure shall be monitored continuously and remain within 1.2 to 3.5 bar
Fuel cell operating temperature shall be maintained within 60-80°C range
Load shall be distributed across fuel cell stacks to minimize thermal cycling
Crew shall have immediate capability to shut down any or all fuel cell stacks
Fuel cell performance shall be monitored continuously for degradation
Flight crew shall retain final decision authority over all CAOS recommendations
CAOS shall provide explanation and confidence level for all safety-relevant recommendations
Crew shall have immediate single-action capability to override/disable CAOS
CAOS safety-critical functions shall have independent safety monitor using conventional algorithms
CAOS operational performance shall be monitored continuously and validated against actual outcomes
All operations shall maintain CG within approved limits for BWB configuration
Rotation rates and pitch attitudes shall prevent tail strike during takeoff and landing
Wing tip and tail clearances shall be maintained during all ground operations
Emergency evacuation capability shall meet 90-second requirement
